doc:
LeRoy Mason https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LeRoy_Mason 0 LeRoy Mason (July 2, 1903 – October 13, 1947) was an American film actor who worked primarily in Westerns in both the silent and sound film eras. He was born LeRoy Franklin Mason in Larimore, North Dakota. Mason's first acting in films (other than bit parts) came in 1926, when he appeared in two low-budget Westerns and the serial Lightning Hutch. He had leading roles in four films from 1928-1930. A shooting accident while he worked on a film in the late 1930s caused him to lose sight in his right eye.Mason was married to actress Bo Ling; they had no children and eventually separated.On October 13, 1947, Mason died of "acute myocardial infarction dure to coronary thrombosis" in the Birmingham Veterans Administration Hospital in Van Nuys, California. He had been there for 31 days after suffering a heart attack on the set of California Firebrand. LeRoy_Mason ( July_2_,_1903 – October_13_,_1947 ) was an_American_film_actor who worked primarily in Westerns in both the_silent_and_sound_film_eras . He was_born LeRoy_Franklin_Mason in Larimore , North_Dakota . Mason 's_first_acting in films ( other than bit_parts ) came in 1926 , when he appeared in two_low-budget_Westerns and the_serial_Lightning_Hutch . He had_leading roles in four_films from 1928-1930 . A_shooting_accident while he worked on a_film in the_late_1930s caused him to_lose sight in his_right_eye.Mason was_married to actress_Bo_Ling ; they had no_children_and_eventually_separated.On_October_13_,_1947 , Mason died of " acute_myocardial_infarction_dure to coronary_thrombosis " in the_Birmingham_Veterans_Administration_Hospital in Van_Nuys , California . He had_been there for 31_days after suffering a_heart_attack on the_set of California_Firebrand .
